heading: special delivery
subheading: if a package shows up in the mail from frankfurt, germany, and you don't recognize the sender, you're probably wise not to open it, or even handle it. the fbi says it has received "unsubstantiated" information that "individuals" may be planning to send mail bombs from germany to addresses in the united states. the fbi isn't saying how much credence it puts in these threats, but has apparently decided to err on the side of caution. great. just picture some overzealous agent submerging your aunt heidi's christmas stollen in a bucket of water.
author: wired staff
